Wireless Client Service

NOTICE:

The namespace prefix http://cisco.com/jnap/ has been deprecated but is still supported. All JNAP clients should switch to the new namespace prefix http://linksys.com/jnap/.

Services

WirelessClient

http://linksys.com/jnap/wirelessclient/WirelessClient

Service Actions

  • GetWirelessClientInfo
  • GetWirelessNetworks
  • GetWirelessProfiles
  • SetWirelessProfiles

Actions

GetWirelessClientInfo

http://linksys.com/jnap/wirelessclient/GetWirelessClientInfo
This action retrieves information about the wireless capabilities of a given device. In addition, if the wireless client is currently associated to a wireless network, the connection information is also included.

Note:

This action is safe to call within the context of a transaction.

Input Parameters

This action does not have any input parameters.

Output Parameters

Name Type Optional Description
radios RadioInfo[] no The list of information for each wireless client's radio.
connection ConnectionInfo yes The wireless client's connection.
This member will be present if and only if the wireless client is currently associated to a wireless network.

Result

http://linksys.com/jnap/wirelessclient/GetWirelessClientInfoResult
Value Description
OK Success.
Error
_ErrorAbortedAction
_ErrorInvalidInput
_ErrorInvalidOutput
_ErrorNotReady
_ErrorSessionVerification
_ErrorUnauthorized
_ErrorUnexpected
_ErrorUnknownAction
_ErrorUnknownSession

Sample Transaction

POST [request-uri] HTTP/1.1
Host: 192.168.1.1
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: [number of octets in request body]
X-JNAP-Action: "http://linksys.com/jnap/wirelessclient/GetWirelessClientInfo"

{
}
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: [number of octets in response body]

{
  "result": "OK",
  "output": {
    "radios": [
      {
        "radioID": "RADIO_2.4GHz",
        "physicalRadioID": "wdev0",
        "bssid": "00:11:22:33:44:55",
        "band": "2.4GHz",
        "supportedNetworkTypes": [
          "Adhoc"
        ],
        "supportedSecurityTypes": [
          "None"
        ]
      }
    ],
    "connection": {
      "ssid": "MySSID",
      "bssid": "00:11:22:33:44:55",
      "band": "2.4GHz",
      "mode": "802.11n",
      "channelWidth": "Standard",
      "channel": 1,
      "signalStrength": 100,
      "noise": 50,
      "linkSpeedIn": 1024,
      "linkSpeedOut": 1024,
      "wmmEnabled": false
    }
  }
}

GetWirelessNetworks

http://linksys.com/jnap/wirelessclient/GetWirelessNetworks
This action retrieves the wireless networks visible to this device.

Note:

This action is safe to call within the context of a transaction.

Input Parameters

This action does not have any input parameters.

Output Parameters

Name Type Optional Description
wirelessNetworks WirelessNetwork[] no The list of wireless networks visible to this device.

Result

http://linksys.com/jnap/wirelessclient/GetWirelessNetworksResult
Value Description
OK Success.
Error
_ErrorAbortedAction
_ErrorInvalidInput
_ErrorInvalidOutput
_ErrorNotReady
_ErrorSessionVerification
_ErrorUnauthorized
_ErrorUnexpected
_ErrorUnknownAction
_ErrorUnknownSession

Sample Transaction

POST [request-uri] HTTP/1.1
Host: 192.168.1.1
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: [number of octets in request body]
X-JNAP-Action: "http://linksys.com/jnap/wirelessclient/GetWirelessNetworks"

{
}
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: [number of octets in response body]

{
  "result": "OK",
  "output": {
    "wirelessNetworks": [
      {
        "ssid": "MySSID",
        "bssid": "00:11:22:33:44:55",
        "networkType": "Adhoc",
        "band": "2.4GHz",
        "signalStrength": 100,
        "security": "WEP",
        "encryption": "WEP-64"
      }
    ]
  }
}

GetWirelessProfiles

http://linksys.com/jnap/wirelessclient/GetWirelessProfiles
This action retrieves the current wireless profiles for this wireless client.

Note:

This action is safe to call within the context of a transaction.

Input Parameters

This action does not have any input parameters.

Output Parameters

Name Type Optional Description
profiles WirelessProfile[] no The list of wireless profiles this wireless client currently has.

Result

http://linksys.com/jnap/wirelessclient/GetWirelessProfilesResult
Value Description
OK Success.
Error
_ErrorAbortedAction
_ErrorInvalidInput
_ErrorInvalidOutput
_ErrorNotReady
_ErrorSessionVerification
_ErrorUnauthorized
_ErrorUnexpected
_ErrorUnknownAction
_ErrorUnknownSession

Sample Transaction

POST [request-uri] HTTP/1.1
Host: 192.168.1.1
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: [number of octets in request body]
X-JNAP-Action: "http://linksys.com/jnap/wirelessclient/GetWirelessProfiles"

{
}
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: [number of octets in response body]

{
  "result": "OK",
  "output": {
    "profiles": [
      {
        "radioID": "RADIO_2.4GHz",
        "ssid": "MySSID",
        "bssid": "00:11:22:33:44:55",
        "networkType": "Adhoc",
        "band": "2.4GHz",
        "security": "WEP",
        "wepSettings": {
          "encryption": "WEP-64",
          "key1": "57CB17F019",
          "key2": "AE2EA067EA",
          "key3": "4731622D25",
          "key4": "E694E841E6",
          "txKey": 1
        }
      }
    ]
  }
}

SetWirelessProfiles

http://linksys.com/jnap/wirelessclient/SetWirelessProfiles
This action sets the wireless profiles for this wireless client to allow it to join a new network.

Note:

This action is safe to call within the context of a transaction.

Input Parameters

Name Type Optional Description
profiles WirelessProfile[] no The wireless profile being added to this wireless client.

Output Parameters

This action does not have any output parameters.

Result

http://linksys.com/jnap/wirelessclient/SetWirelessProfilesResult
Value Description
OK Success.
Error
ErrorInvalidKey The specified WEP key was not valid.
ErrorInvalidPassphrase The specified WPA passphrases was not valid.
ErrorInvalidRADIUSPort The specified RADIUS port values was not valid.
ErrorInvalidRADIUSServer The specified RADIUS servers was not valid.
ErrorInvalidSSID The specified SSIDs was not between 1 and 32 bytes long.
ErrorInvalidSharedKey The specified WPA-Enterprise shared keys was not valid.
ErrorInvalidTXKey The specified WEP TX key value was not between 1 and 4.
ErrorMissingWEPSettings The specified wireless security type was WEP, but no WEP settings were specified for that radio.
ErrorMissingWPAEnterpriseSettings The specified wireless security type was a WPA-Enterprise variant, but the no WPA-Enterprise settings were specified for that radio.
ErrorMissingWPAPersonalSettings The specified wireless security type was a WPA-Personal variant, but no WPA-Personal settings were specified for that radio.
ErrorUnknownRadio One of the specified radio IDs does not correspond to an actual radio in the access point.
ErrorUnsupportedNetworkType The specified network type is unsupported.
ErrorUnsupportedSecurity The specified wireless security is unsupported.
_ErrorAbortedAction
_ErrorInvalidInput
_ErrorInvalidOutput
_ErrorNotReady
_ErrorSessionVerification
_ErrorUnauthorized
_ErrorUnexpected
_ErrorUnknownAction
_ErrorUnknownSession

Sample Transaction

POST [request-uri] HTTP/1.1
Host: 192.168.1.1
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: [number of octets in request body]
X-JNAP-Action: "http://linksys.com/jnap/wirelessclient/SetWirelessProfiles"

{
  "profiles": [
    {
      "radioID": "RADIO_2.4GHz",
      "ssid": "MySSID",
      "bssid": "00:11:22:33:44:55",
      "networkType": "Adhoc",
      "band": "2.4GHz",
      "security": "WEP",
      "wepSettings": {
        "encryption": "WEP-64",
        "key1": "57CB17F019",
        "key2": "AE2EA067EA",
        "key3": "4731622D25",
        "key4": "E694E841E6",
        "txKey": 1
      }
    }
  ]
}
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: [number of octets in response body]

{
  "result": "OK"
}

Structures

WEPSettings

http://linksys.com/jnap/wirelessap/WEPSettings
Settings used when a wireless radio's security type is WEP.

Structure Members

Member Name Type Optional Description
encryption WEPEncryption no The WEP encryption type.
key1 string no The first WEP key value. If the value of the encryption member is WEP-64, this value must be exactly 10 hexadecimal digits or an empty string. If the value of the encryption member is WEP-128, this value must be exactly 26 hexadecimal digits or an empty string. Specifying the empty string will clear the key if it was previously set.
key2 string no The second WEP key value. If the value of the encryption member is WEP-64, this value must be exactly 10 hexadecimal digits or an empty string. If the value of the encryption member is WEP-128, this value must be exactly 26 hexadecimal digits or an empty string. Specifying the empty string will clear the key if it was previously set.
key3 string no The third WEP key value. If the value of the encryption member is WEP-64, this value must be exactly 10 hexadecimal digits or an empty string. If the value of the encryption member is WEP-128, this value must be exactly 26 hexadecimal digits or an empty string. Specifying the empty string will clear the key if it was previously set.
key4 string no The fourth WEP key value. If the value of the encryption member is WEP-64, this value must be exactly 10 hexadecimal digits or an empty string. If the value of the encryption member is WEP-128, this value must be exactly 26 hexadecimal digits or an empty string. Specifying the empty string will clear the key if it was previously set.
txKey int no The index specifying which key value to use for encryption. The value of the corresponding key cannot be an empty string. This value must be between 1 and 4.

WPAEnterpriseSettings

http://linksys.com/jnap/wirelessap/WPAEnterpriseSettings
Settings used when a wireless radio's security type is a WPA-Enterprise variant.

Structure Members

Member Name Type Optional Description
radiusServer IPAddress no The IP address of the RADIUS server.
The following restrictions from RFC 5735 are applied to the RADIUS server address.
Address Block Description Reference
0.0.0.0/8 "This" Network RFC 1122, Section 3.2.1.3
127.0.0.0/8 Loopback RFC 1122, Section 3.2.1.3
169.254.0.0/16 Link Local RFC 3927
224.0.0.0/4 Multicast RFC 3171
240.0.0.0/4 Reserved for Future Use RFC 1112, Section 4
255.255.255.255/32 Limited Broadcast RFC 919, Section 7  RFC 922, Section 7
radiusPort int no The port number of the RADIUS server.
sharedKey string no The RADIUS shared secret. This value must be composed entirely of characters in the range U+0032 - U+007E (printable ASCII) and cannot be an empty string.

WPAPersonalSettings

http://linksys.com/jnap/wirelessap/WPAPersonalSettings
Settings used when a wireless radio's security type is a WPA-Personal variant.

Structure Members

Member Name Type Optional Description
passphrase string no The WPA passphrase. This value must either be a 8-63 characters in the range U+0032 - U+007E (printable ASCII) or exactly 64 ASCII hexadecimal digits.

ConnectionInfo

http://linksys.com/jnap/wirelessclient/ConnectionInfo
The wireless client's connection information.

Structure Members

Member Name Type Optional Description
ssid string no The wireless network name (SSID) that this device is currently connected to.
bssid MACAddress no BSSID of the wireless network that this device is currently connected to.
band WirelessBand no The wireless frequency band that the radio is configured for.
mode WirelessMode no The 802.11 mode that the radio is configured for.
channelWidth WirelessChannelWidth no The wireless channel width being used. Note that "Wide" is not allowed when mode is set to "802.11a". 802.11a does not support wide channels.
channel int no Channel number the radio is currently set to.
signalStrength int no The Received Signal Strength Indicator as a percentage of maximum possible strength.
While RSSI is typically measured in dB, the boundaries of these values are vendor-specific. The device should map the vendor specific range into a percentage for this call.
If the radio is not connected this value should be set to 0.
Valid values are 0-100.
noise int yes The Noise as a percentage of maximum possible strength.
While Noise is typically measured in dB, the boundaries of these values are vendor-specific. The device should map the vendor specific range into a percentage for this call.
If the radio is not connected this value should be set to 0.
Valid values are 0-100.
JNAP clients can determine the quality of a clients connection by calculating the Signal/Noise ratio.
linkSpeedIn int yes The data rate (kbps) of the inbound link to this client.
Note that in wired Ethernet cases, the inbound and outbound speeds are usually symmetrical. In the case of wireless or homeplug technologies, these rates may be different.
If the linkspeed is unknown, or the device is not connected the implementer should return 0.
linkSpeedOut int yes The data rate (kbps) of the outbound link to this client.
If the linkspeed is unknown, or the device is not connected the implementer should return 0.
wmmEnabled bool yes Returns True if WMM is enabled on the device, otherwise False

RadioInfo

http://linksys.com/jnap/wirelessclient/RadioInfo
Information about a wireless client's radio. This structure is returned from the GetWirelessClientInfo action.

Structure Members

Member Name Type Optional Description
radioID string no The unique identifier of the radio. This value never changes for a particular radio, and no two radios on the same wireless access point will have the same radio ID.
physicalRadioID string no The unique identifier of the physical radio hardware. This value never changes for a particular radio. However, multiple radios within the wireless access point may have the same physical radio ID if the access point has a selectable-band radio. In this case, radios that have the same physical radio ID represent mutually-exclusive configurations of the same physical radio, and modifying settings of one radio will cause the settings of the other radio to be modified as well. Only one of the radios that share a physical radio can be enabled at any given time; enabling such a radio will cause the other radios to be disabled.
bssid MACAddress no The radio's BSSID.
band WirelessBand no The radio's wireless frequency band.
supportedNetworkTypes WirelessNetworkType[] no The list of network modes supported by this device. The array should contain at least one entry.
supportedSecurityTypes WirelessSecurity[] no The list of wireless security types supported by this device. The array should contain at least one entry.

WirelessNetwork

http://linksys.com/jnap/wirelessclient/WirelessNetwork
Settings associated with a wireless network.

Structure Members

Member Name Type Optional Description
ssid string no The wireless network name (SSID) of this wireless network.
bssid MACAddress no BSSID of the this wireless network.
networkType WirelessNetworkType no The type of network.
band WirelessBand no The wireless frequency band that the radio is configured for.
signalStrength int no The Received Signal Strength Indicator as a percentage of maximum possible strength.
While RSSI is typically measured in dB, the boundaries of these values are vendor-specific. The device should map the vendor specific range into a percentage for this call.
Valid values are 0-100.
security WirelessSecurity no The type of wireless security.
encryption WEPEncryption yes The WEP encryption type. This value will be present if and only if the value of the security member is WEP.

WirelessProfile

http://linksys.com/jnap/wirelessclient/WirelessProfile
The wireless profile used for connecting a wireless client to an access point.

Structure Members

Member Name Type Optional Description
radioID string no The unique identifier of the radio. This value never changes for a particular radio, and no two radios on the same wireless access point will have the same radio ID.
ssid string no The wireless network name (SSID) to be used for profile.
bssid MACAddress yes BSSID of the this wireless profile
networkType WirelessNetworkType yes The type of network.
band WirelessBand yes The wireless frequency band.
security WirelessSecurity no The type of wireless security.
wepSettings WEPSettings yes The wireless client's WEP settings. This value is required if the value of the security member is WEP.
wpaPersonalSettings WPAPersonalSettings yes The wireless client's WPA-Personal settings. This value is required if the value of the security member is WPA-Personal.
wpaEnterpriseSettings WPAEnterpriseSettings yes The wireless client's WPA-Enterprise settings. This value is required if the value of the security member is WPA-Enterprise.

Enumerations

WEPEncryption

http://linksys.com/jnap/wirelessap/WEPEncryption
Types of WEP encryption.

Enumeration Values

Value Description
WEP-64 64-bit WEP encryption with a 40-bit key. This value should only be used when the security type is WEP.
WEP-128 128-bit WEP encryption with a 104-bit key. This value should only be used when the security type is WEP.

WirelessBand

http://linksys.com/jnap/wirelessap/WirelessBand
This service provides access to properties and settings of the 802.11 wireless access point. Wireless frequency bands.

Enumeration Values

Value Description
2.4GHz The 2.4GHz frequency band.
5GHz The 5GHz frequency band.
6GHz The 6GHz frequency band.

WirelessChannelWidth

http://linksys.com/jnap/wirelessap/WirelessChannelWidth
Possible wireless channel widths.

Enumeration Values

Value Description
Auto The wireless access point will automatically determine the wireless channel width.
Standard The wireless channel is 20 MHz wide.
Wide The wireless channel is 40 MHz wide.
Wide80 The wireless channel is 80 MHz wide.
Wide160c The wireless channel is contiguous 160 MHz wide.
Wide160nc The wireless channel is non-contiguous 160 MHz wide.

WirelessMode

http://linksys.com/jnap/wirelessap/WirelessMode
Modes representing types of wireless traffic that a wireless radio will accept.

Enumeration Values

Value Description
802.11a The radio only accepts 802.11a traffic.
802.11b The radio only accepts 802.11b traffic.
802.11g The radio only accepts 802.11g traffic.
802.11n The radio only accepts 802.11n traffic.
802.11ac The radio only accepts 802.11ac traffic.
802.11ax The radio only accepts 802.11ax traffic.
802.11an The radio only accepts 802.11a and 802.11n traffic.
802.11bg The radio only accepts 802.11b and 802.11g traffic.
802.11bn The radio only accepts 802.11b and 802.11n traffic.
802.11gn The radio only accepts 802.11g and 802.11n traffic.
802.11anac The radio only accepts 802.11a, 802.11n, and 802.11ac traffic.
802.11anacax The radio only accepts 802.11a, 802.11n, 802.11ac and 802.11ax traffic.
802.11anacaxbe The radio only accepts 802.11a, 802.11n, 802.11ac, 802.11ax and 802.11be traffic.
802.11bgn The radio only accepts 802.11b, 802.11g, and 802.11n traffic.
802.11bgnac The radio only accepts 802.11b, 802.11g, 802.11n and 802.11ac traffic.
802.11bgnax The radio only accepts 802.11b, 802.11g, 802.11n and 802.11ax traffic.
802.11axbe The radio only accepts 802.11ax and 802.11be traffic.
802.11mixed The radio accepts mixed mode traffic.

WirelessSecurity

http://linksys.com/jnap/wirelessap/WirelessSecurity
Wireless security types supported by a wireless radio. Each security type represents a combination of an 802.11 wireless protocol, authentication, and encryption. All possible combinations are not represented, only those that are reasonable options for a modern wireless access point to expose.

Enumeration Values

Value Description
None No authentication or encryption; commonly referred to as "open".
WEP WEP protocol with no authentication and WEP encryption using a preshared key; commonly referred to as "WEP shared".
WPA-Personal WPA protocol with preshared-key authentication and TKIP encryption.
WPA-Enterprise WPA protocol with RADIUS authentication and TKIP encryption.
WPA2-Personal WPA2 protocol with preshared-key authentication and AES encryption.
WPA2-Enterprise WPA2 protocol with RADIUS authentication and AES encryption.
WPA-Mixed-Personal Either WPA-Personal or WPA2-Personal.
WPA-Mixed-Enterprise Either WPA-Enterprise or WPA2-Enterprise.
WPA2/WPA3-Mixed-Personal Either WPA2-Personal or WPA3-Personal.
WPA3-Personal WPA3 protocol with preshared-key authentication and AES encryption.
WPA3-Enterprise WPA3 protocol with RADIUS authentication and AES encryption.
Enhanced-Open+None Wi-Fi Alliance®'s Wi-Fi CERTIFIED Enhanced Open™ OWE Transition mode. See http://wi-fi.org/enhanced-open.
Enhanced-Open-Only Wi-Fi Alliance®'s Wi-Fi CERTIFIED Enhanced Open™ OWE Only mode. See http://wi-fi.org/enhanced-open.

WirelessNetworkType

http://linksys.com/jnap/wirelessclient/WirelessNetworkType
This service provides access to properties and settings of 802.11 wireless clients. Types of wireless networks.

Enumeration Values

Value Description
Adhoc Communicate directly with other peers
Infrastructure Communicate with an Access Point
